meanings.definition: In a state of being more prepared or willing
meanings.sent1: She felt readier than ever to face the challenge ahead.
meanings.sent2: He became readier to help his friends when they needed him.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed readier to chase the laser pointer than to nap.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was readier than a sponge to absorb new information.
meanings.sent5: The soldier's readier stance showed his determination to succeed.

meanings.definition: More inclined or likely to do something
meanings.sent1: The adventurous explorer was always readier to embark on new journeys.
meanings.sent2: As the day went on, she grew readier to try the exotic dish.
meanings.sent3: The readier squirrel was the first to grab the acorn and scurry away.
meanings.sent4: His readier nature made him the go-to person for solving problems.
meanings.sent5: The readier student eagerly raised her hand to answer the question.
